intro: Cheiridopsis duplessii, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces delicate, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in winter. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
